intro: Uncaria gambir var. angulata, commonly known as gambir angulata, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twisted, angular stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and red berries that contain the seeds. It is cultivated for its medicinal properties, particularly the compound polyphenol known as gambogic acid. Its botanical features make it distinct from other Uncaria species, especially in its unique stem morphology.
